target_text: "The agile process itself is subject to continuous improvements. We use retrospectives to continuously reflect on the way we work to become better at what we do and ultimately better at delivering quality software. That’s the process."

Codebook.Definition: The ongoing effort to enhance processes, practices, or products to achieve better outcomes over time.
Regular meetings where team members reflect on their work processes to identify areas for improvement and celebrate successes.
The goal of producing software that meets or exceeds customer expectations in terms of functionality, reliability, and performance.
A flexible and iterative approach to software development that emphasizes collaboration, customer feedback, and small, rapid releases.
